info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 9:59PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Jackson County through 1030 PM PDT... At 957 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kennedy Meadows, or 13 miles southwest of Medford, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding and standing water is possible, along with rapid rises on small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Cantrall Buckley County Park, Kennedy Meadows and McKee Bridge Recreation Site. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
